text:
André Bourbeau (June 1, 1936 – March 25, 2018) was a Canadian politician. He was a member of the Quebec Liberal Party. Bourbeau served as member of the National Assembly of Quebec for Laporte serving from 1981 until 2003.
Bourbeau was the founding president of the Montreal International Music Competition.
Bourbeau was diagnosed with leukemia in 1998. He died of complications from cancer on March 25, 2018 in Montreal, at the age of 81.
